txt.en: As you read, additional text appears!
You should read the moon-runes on the parchment.
The Moon-runes of Veluk-zámok
You should read the moon-runes on the parchment.
Read the moon-runes
Inspect the parchment

'Have you heard of the fabled underground realm, Thafar-gathol, the Grey Citadel? No dwarf has ever found it, but the lost realm is said to exist somewhere in these northern mountains. I have brought a moon-letter from the east with me. It is said this letter contains a clue as to the location of Thafar-gathol. The tale goes, if a great dwarf finds the Stave of Veluk-zámok, the path to Thafar-gathol will become clear.\n\n'Here, you may borrow the moon-letter, if you like. I am at an end with this riddle. I am no closer to finding the Stave now than I was before I came to Ered Mithrin.'
You should search in the Grey Mountains for the third location, described in moon-runes, on Hórin's parchment.
The Glimmerdeep can be found north of Skarháld in the Grey Mountains.\n\nYou should examine the location in the Glimmerdeep mentioned on Hórin's parchment.
Read the moon-runes
Hórin may be in Skarháld or adventuring with you.\n\nYou should talk to Hórin.
It seems no dragon or its hoard remain here
This is not a good place to read the parchment
Read the moon-runes
TBD
Solve the parchment's second riddle
This must be the location
This must be the location
Hórin, a Zhélruka Dwarf tasked to dealing with outsiders, seeks assistance in deciphering an ancient moon-letter.
You should inspect the parchment that Hórin gave you.
Solve the parchment's riddle
This is not a good place to read the moon-runes
You should search in the Grey Mountains for the location hinted at in Hórin's parchment.
You should read the moon-runes on the parchment.
It would seem the moon-letter speaks of a cavern somewhere in the Grey Mountains
As you read, additional text appears!

You tell Hórin how you followed the clues and learned the location of the Stave of Veluk-zámok. His eyes widen.

'In Glimmerdeep, of all places, among the treasure of a dragon! Yet dragon and treasure are not to be found? And why not? Centuries upon centuries have passed. And yet dragons live longer than centuries....

'Perhaps, perhaps not all hope is lost.'

You tell Hórin how you followed the clues and learned the location of the Stave of Veluk-zámok. His eyes widen.

'In Glimmerdeep, of all places, among the treasure of a dragon! Yet dragon and treasure are not to be found? And why not? Centuries upon centuries have passed. And yet dragons live longer than centuries....

'Perhaps, perhaps not all hope is lost.'
This must be the location
This is not a good place to read the moon-runes
Look for a clue in the Glimmerdeep
This must be the location of the Stave!
Talk to Hórin
You should search in the Grey Mountains for the second location, described in moon-runes, on Hórin's parchment.
It would seem the moon-letter speaks of a hill somewhere in the Grey Mountains
As you read, additional text appears!
Solve the parchment's third riddle
It would seem the moon-letter speaks of another hill somewhere in the Grey Mountains
